dsDescriptionValue.value:
The BCURE-Harvard training needs survey was designed to assess the attitudes, practices, and skills with regard to applying data and evidence in the work of mid-career and senior civil servants in India and Pakistan, as well as to shed light on their decision-making contexts, barriers to evidence use, and preferred training content and formats. Data were collected from the following training cohorts:

Pakistan – National School of Public Policy (NSPP)
  • Mid-Career Management Course 16—Lahore (48 respondents, paper-based survey, 93.8% response rate)—February 2014
  • Mid-Career Management Course 18—Lahore, Islamabad, Karachi (119 respondents, paper-based survey, 96.0% response rate)—October 2014
  • Senior Management Course 16—Lahore (70 respondents, online survey, 78.7% response rate)—December 2014
India – Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy of Administration (LBSNAA)
  • Phase IV (51 respondents, online survey, 91.1% response rate)—June/July 2014
  • Phase V (56 respondents, online survey, 52.5% response rate)—October 2014

files.description: Combined and cleaned data from the training needs assessment surveys administered in 2014 to civil servants from the Phase IV and Phase V cohorts in India and the Mid-Career Management Cohorts and Senior Management Cohorts in Pakistan.
files.label: BCURE Training Needs Assessment Data.tab

dataFile.description: Combined and cleaned data from the training needs assessment surveys administered in 2014 to civil servants from the Phase IV and Phase V cohorts in India and the Mid-Career Management Cohorts and Senior Management Cohorts in Pakistan.
